userStories.title: Apply Quiet Minimalism design system
userStories.description: As a user, I want a calm, minimal interface that prioritizes clarity and lets content breathe.
acceptanceCriteria: Layout: Single column, centered content (max-width ~640px), generous vertical whitespace
Typography: System fonts or clean sans-serif (Geist, Inter), limited hierarchy (one heading size, body, muted captions), lowercase text for approachable tone
Colors: Near-white background (#fafafa), dark gray text (#171717), muted grays for secondary (#737373, #a3a3a3), single accent color used sparingly
Interactions: Subtle hover states (color shifts, no animations), underlined links with offset, minimal motion
Content: Information as simple scannable rows, minimal footers, no visual clutter
Remove all unnecessary decorative elements
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Philosophy: Let content breathe. Remove everything that doesn't earn its place. Character through restraint, not decoration.
